      Inner Mongolia Grand Hotel is an excellent choice for travelers visiting Beijing, offering a family-friendly environment alongside many helpful amenities designed to enhance your stay.

      For those interested in checking out popular landmarks while visiting Beijing, Inner Mongolia Grand Hotel is located a short distance from Forbidden City-The Palace Museum (1.4 mi) and Temple of Heaven (1.4 mi).

      Inner Mongolia Grand Hotel offers guests an array of room amenities including a flat screen TV, air conditioning, and a minibar, and getting online is possible, as free wifi is available.

      The hotel offers room service and a concierge, to make your visit even more pleasant. The property also features a fitness center and an on-site restaurant.

      If you like Asian restaurants, Inner Mongolia Grand Hotel is conveniently located near Dadong Roast Duck (Nanxincang), Quanjude Roast Duck (Wangfujing), and Donghuamen Night Market.

      If youre looking for something to do, Wangfujing Street (0.6 mi) and Tiananmen Square (Tiananmen Guangchang) (1.1 mi) are a nice way to spend some time, and they are all within walking distance of Inner Mongolia Grand Hotel.

      Enjoy your stay in Beijing!

      Jane E wrote a review Jan 2020
      New York City, New York537 contributions420 helpful votes
      Good Choice
      I arrived by train from Harbin not realizing how close this hotel is to the main train station. Close enough that I could have walked in warmer weather. It also resulted in an issue at departure because no taxi was interested in making such a short journey back to the station. Not the hotel's fault but something to be aware of. That aside the Inner Mongolia Grand turned out to be a very good choice from many aspects. It is a big hotel with a huge lobby. My room was reasonably high on the 10th floor with a view out over surrounding buildings. Not a beautiful view but it was good to have no buildings of the same height nearby. The room was fairly standard. Not big but similar to many other hotels with a king size bed, desk and armchair. There was a safe, iron and ironing board and a mini bar that contained only a few soft drinks. There was a kettle but no coffee maker which seems to be standard in China hotels. The bathroom was fairly small with a walk-in shower and lots of toiletries with some of them stored in a nice leather box on the vanity counter. I found the hotel very quiet. The wifi was pretty dire as is common in China. Many websites are blocked or perhaps self block and others are slow to open. The wifi worked okay with a few websites, slow with others and not at all with many and it was hard to know what was a problem with the wifi and what with China's internet in general. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the downtown pedestrian street (Wangfujing Street) and the huge, new Oriental Mall. it is also really close to a metro station making for easy connections all over the city. I tried to get some information from the concierge but they had some difficulty in providing clear directions and the hotel map is close to useless. That said, they were very helpful in getting me a taxi back to the station even in the face of taxi drivers' reluctance to accept a ride of that short distance. Overall, the Inner Mongolia hotel is recommended for its location and the standard of the rooms which I found very clean and very quiet and I would stay there again if back in Beijing.

      We had a great stay here!
      The check in process was painless and the lovely Ayla upgraded us to a bigger room! We were also able to collect the pocket wifi and train tickets wed had delivered to the hotel in advance from the friendly guys at concierge. Our room was spacious (40sqm) and had large wall to wall windows to enjoy the view. The bed was extremely comfortable as were the chairs near the window. The hotel is a little tired but for the price and convenient location it was worth it. My husband tried the breakfast buffet and said it was good. There are 2 subway stations nearby with access to different lines which were handy. Even in the cold, we chose to walk to and from Wangfujing as it wasnt too far.

      eehotel wrote a review Dec 2019
      Sao Paulo, SP125 contributions88 helpful votes
      Great choice and excellent cost benefit
      This is a perfectly located hotel in the central are of Beijing, really close to the metro, supermarket, and within walking distance from several main attractions. The rooms are spacious and overlook the park in front of the hotel (which is worth the visit to learn of the daily activities by locals). Bed, amenities, service, all of good quality. The staff is very very helpful and several are fluent in English. We particularly liked the non imposing expenditures for eventual services: we were able to use the business center and print staff at no cost (certain hours), had just a soup in the otherwise expensive and huge buffet, and had fruits we bought outside peeled as a favor. The rooms may have a couple of weird looking tiles, or not so modern furniture, but this is a hotel much cheaper than others in the area, offering comfort and services of quality.

      rhyss4ever wrote a review Nov 2019
      Singapore, Singapore248 contributions83 helpful votes
      Good location and some friendly staff
      We stayed from 17-24 Oct 19, and we were from Singapore. My friend wanted to stay this hotel as it has many good reviews...!! I didn't read the reviews about this hotel advance. When about to write then realised quite handful of people feedback about their Reception staff. I would share my experiences with you after the good one. First, the location was super good. Dongdan subway station is the nearest. Chongwenmen station also near, just few more minutes different. Both within walking distance. We didn't see any elevator at these 2 stations. The information, lobby, and housekeeping, these 3 groups of staff were very helpful and friendly. Housekeeping - on 2nd day, when we back to our hotel, we saw extra hangers were given to us. When our room's TV was not functioning properly at few occasions. They were prompt to help. Another incident, our safebox non stop beeping when we were about to go out. They checked and informed us that they would get it done before we returned. So, when we back to our hotel, we saw a note, the work has been done. Information counter staff - very resourceful and friendly. They helped us when I was unsure how to use Didi app and Dianping app. They helped us to cancel our taxi booking. And how to use Dianping to make appointment with Dadong restaurant. Lobby staff - especially one of the lady with short hair. She was really helpful. She able to give good advices where to go during one of our free evening. Remind us to don extra, and keep ourselves warm. Thumb up, and give them applause to these 3 groups of staffs. At least they make me feel my stay overall happy and satisfied. Now I would to share some unpleasant experiences with the Reception staff. Both my friend and myself shared the same sentimental. First, we felt the staff who doing the check-in was dull. He didn't make efforts to maintain proper eye contact with us. And he failed to give us WiFi Password!! 2nd incident, we enquired about making appointments at Dadong restaurant. They brushed us off to the information counter. I would use the word impolite. 3rd incident, one day about 9.30pm, I was going toward the direction where the office selling stamps. I wanted to check what time the office open in the morning. Guess what..one of the female staff shouted at me, questioning me where am I going. She was damn rude as there were other guests around. So unprofessional. Overall, this hotel scored the most mainly good location which near to 2 subway stations. Going to anywhere, no fear. We took buses, subway and Didi (private car).
